variants.Description in input context: C289G mutation in the RING domain of Parkin

Material used.Description: Cells expressing wild-type or C289G mutant Parkin were used to assess mitochondrial localization and mitophagy induction.

Readout description.Result Description: C289G mutant failed to redistribute to damaged mitochondria and induce mitophagy compared to wild-type Parkin.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated in triplicate across independent cell cultures.

Technical replicates.Description: Each condition was tested in technical triplicates for each biological replicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type Parkin was used as a positive control for mitochondrial localization and mitophagy.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection was used as a negative control for Parkin expression.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with post-hoc testing (e.g., Tukey's HSD) was used to compare groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Mitochondrial localization and mitophagy induction comparable to wild-type Parkin.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Failure to localize to damaged mitochondria or induce mitophagy.

Material used.Description: Co-expression of C289G Parkin with HSJ1a/DNAJB6 was tested for aggregation suppression.

Readout description.Result Description: C289G mutant showed increased aggregation, which was suppressed by HSJ1a/DNAJB6 co-expression.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated in triplicate across independent cell cultures.

Technical replicates.Description: Each condition was tested in technical triplicates for each biological replicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type Parkin co-expressed with HSJ1a/DNAJB6 was used as a positive control for aggregation suppression.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection was used as a negative control for aggregation suppression.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired t-test with Welch's correction was used to compare groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Aggregation levels comparable to wild-type Parkin.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly increased aggregation compared to wild-type Parkin.
